description: Core data models and interfaces for a Tetris game, including board state, piece placement, rotations, and shape definitions. This file defines the fundamental logic used for game mechanics, independent of UI components.

classes.name: Coord
classes.description: Represents a coordinate point with x and y. Supports addition to combine positions.

classes.name: TetrominoType
classes.description: Enumerates the seven Tetris piece types: I, O, T, S, Z, J, L.

classes.name: Rotation
classes.description: Represents rotation states and includes methods to rotate clockwise and counter-clockwise.

classes.name: PieceState
classes.description: Encapsulates the current state of a Tetris piece, including type, rotation, and origin position. Provides method to get occupied blocks.

classes.name: BoardCell
classes.description: Represents a cell in the game board, indicating if it is filled and its piece type if filled.

classes.name: BoardState
classes.description: Represents the game board, including size, grid state, and collision detection methods.

methods.name: blocks
methods.description: Returns list of block coordinates for a given piece type and rotation.

methods.name: collides
methods.description: Determines if given coordinates collide with filled cells or are out of bounds.
